specJson.name: brightics.function.clustering$gaussian_mixture_train
specJson.description:
A Gaussian mixture model is a probabilistic model that assumes all the data points are generated from a mixture of a finite number of Gaussian distributions with unknown parameters. One can think of mixture models as generalizing k-means clustering to incorporate information about the covariance structure of the data as well as the centers of the latent Gaussians.

- Pros : It is the fastest algorithm for learning mixture models. As this algorithm maximizes only the likelihood, it will not bias the means towards zero, or bias the cluster sizes to have specific structures that might or might not apply.

- Cons : When one has insufficiently many points per mixture, estimating the covariance matrices becomes difficult, and the algorithm is known to diverge and find solutions with infinite likelihood unless one regularizes the covariances artificially. This algorithm will always use all the components it has access to, needing held-out data or information theoretical criteria to decide how many components to use in the absence of external cues.

Reference:
+ <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mixture_model#Gaussian_mixture_model>
+ <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.mixture.GaussianMixture.html>

params.label: Input Columns
params.description: Input column names. Only values in numeric type are possible.

params.label: Covariance Type
params.description:
String describing the type of covariance parameters to use. Must be one of:

 Full : each component has its own general covariance matrix
 Tied : all components share the same general covariance matrix
 Diagonal : each component has its own diagonal covariance matrix
 Spherical : each component has its own single variance

params.label: Tolerance
params.description: The convergence threshold. EM iterations will stop when the lower bound average gain is below this threshold.

params.label: Regularization of Covariance
params.description: Non-negative regularization added to the diagonal of covariance. Allows to assure that the covariance matrices are all positive.

params.label: Number of Iteration
params.description: The number of EM iterations to perform.

params.label: Method to Initialize
params.description:
The method used to initialize the weights, the means and the precisions. Must be one of:

K-means : responsibilities are initialized using kmeans.
Random : responsibilities are initialized randomly.

params.label: Seed
params.description: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results.

summary.en: This function trains an gaussian mixture clustering model.

md.en: # Gaussian Mixture Train This function trains an gaussian mixture clustering model. ## Description A Gaussian mixture model is a probabilistic model that assumes all the data points are generated from a mixture of a finite number of Gaussian distributions with unknown parameters. One can think of mixture models as generalizing k-means clustering to incorporate information about the covariance structure of the data as well as the centers of the latent Gaussians. - Pros : It is the fastest algorithm for learning mixture models. As this algorithm maximizes only the likelihood, it will not bias the means towards zero, or bias the cluster sizes to have specific structures that might or might not apply. - Cons : When one has insufficiently many points per mixture, estimating the covariance matrices becomes difficult, and the algorithm is known to diverge and find solutions with infinite likelihood unless one regularizes the covariances artificially. This algorithm will always use all the components it has access to, needing held-out data or information theoretical criteria to decide how many components to use in the absence of external cues. Reference: + + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Training data in a Table. It must contain at least one column for labels. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (Model) Trained Gaussian Mixture model. #### PARAMETER 1. **Input Columns***: Input column names. Only values in numeric type are possible. 2. **Number of Components**: The number of mixture components. 3. **Covariance Type**: String describing the type of covariance parameters to use. Must be one of: * `Full` : each component has its own general covariance matrix * `Tied` : all components share the same general covariance matrix * `Diagonal` : each component has its own diagonal covariance matrix * `Spherical` : each component has its own single variance 4. **Tolerance**: The convergence threshold. EM iterations will stop when the lower bound average gain is below this threshold. 5. **Regularization of Covariance**: Non-negative regularization added to the diagonal of covariance. Allows to assure that the covariance matrices are all positive. 6. **Number of Iteration**: The number of EM iterations to perform. 7. **Method to Initialize**: The method used to initialize the weights, the means and the precisions. Must be one of: * `K-means` : responsibilities are initialized using kmeans. * `Random` : responsibilities are initialized randomly. 8. **Seed**: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results. 9. **Group By**: Columns to group by. ### Python #### USAGE ``` gaussian_mixture_train(table, input_cols, number_of_components=1, covariance_type='full', tolerance=0.001,regularize_covariance=0.000001, max_iteration=100, initial_params='kmeans', seed=None, group_by=None) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Training data in a Table. It must contain at least one column for labels. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (Model) Trained Gaussian Mixture model. #### PARAMETER 1. **input_cols***: Input column names. Only values in numeric type are possible. * Type: *list[str]* 2. **number_of_components**: The number of mixture components. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 1 (value >= 1) 3. **covariance_type**: String describing the type of covariance parameters to use. Must be one of: * `full` : each component has its own general covariance matrix * `tied` : all components share the same general covariance matrix * `diagonal` : each component has its own diagonal covariance matrix * `spherical` : each component has its own single variance * Type: *str* * Default / Range: full ( full | tied | diag | spherical ) 4. **tolerance**: The convergence threshold. EM iterations will stop when the lower bound average gain is below this threshold. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 0.001 (value > 0) 5. **regularize_covariance**: Non-negative regularization added to the diagonal of covariance. Allows to assure that the covariance matrices are all positive. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 0.000001 (value > 0) 6. **max_iteration**: The number of EM iterations to perform. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 100 (value >= 1) 7. **initial_params**: The method used to initialize the weights, the means and the precisions. Must be one of: * `kmeans` : responsibilities are initialized using kmeans. * `random` : responsibilities are initialized randomly. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: kmeans ( kmeans | random ) 8. **seed**: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results. * Type: *int* * Default value: None 9. **group_by**: Columns to group by. * Type: *list[str]* * Default value: None ## Example ### VA **[Related Tutorial]** **[Sample Model]** In this tutorial workflow, sample_iris data is used to train a gaussian mixture. The generated model is afterward applied to a test data set to predict the cluster of data, by using Gaussian Mixture Predict function. The parameter settings used in the function are shown below. ++Parameters++ 1. **Input Columns***: sepal_length, sepal_width 2. **Number of Components**: 3 3. **Covariance Type**: Full 4. **Tolerance**: 0.001 5. **Regularization of Covariance**: 0.000001 6. **Number of Iteration**: 100 7. **Method to Initialize**: K-means 8. **Seed**: None 9. **Group By**: None ### Python ``` from brightics.function.clustering import gaussian_mixture_train input_table = inputs[0] result = gaussian_mixture_train(table=input_table, input_cols=['sepal_width', 'sepal_length'], number_of_components=3, covariance_type='full', tolerance=0.001, regularize_covariance=0.000001, max_iteration=100, initial_params='kmeans', seed=None, group_by=None) output = result['model'] ``` In this python script, sample_iris data is used to train a gaussian mixture. The generated model can be applied to a test data set to predict the cluster of data, by using Gaussian Mixture Predict function.
md.kr: # 가우시안 혼합 Train 가우시안 혼합 (Gaussian Mixture) 군집 모델 학습. ## Description 가우시안 혼합 모델은 모든 데이터 지점들이 알려지지 않은 변수를 가진 유한한 가우시안 분포의 혼합에서 생성된다고 가정하는 확률 모델입니다. 혼합 모델은 잠재적인 가우시안 중심뿐만 아니라 데이터의 공분산 구조에 대한 정보를 통합하기 위해 k- 평균 군집화를 일반화하는 것으로 생각할 수 있습니다. - 장점 : 혼합 모델 학습을 위한 가장 빠른 알고리즘입니다. 이 알고리즘은 가능성을 최대화하므로 평균을 0에 가깝지 않게 하거나 적용 하거나 하지 않을 구조에 클러스터 크기를 어느 한쪽으로 기울지 않게 합니다. - 단점 : 혼합 당 점이 충분하지 않으면 공분산 행렬을 추정하기가 어려워지며, 알고리즘은 공분산을 인위적으로 정규화하지 않는 한 무한한 가능성으로 솔루션을 분기하고 찾는 것으로 알려져 있습니다. 이 알고리즘은 항상 외부 큐가 없을 때 사용할 컴포넌트 수를 결정하기 위해 보유 데이터 또는 이론적인 기준이 필요한 접근 가능한 모든 컴포넌트를 사용합니다. Reference: + + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (테이블) 테이블의 학습 데이터. 라벨에 대한 열을 하나 이상 포함해야합니다. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (모델) 학습된 가우시안 혼합 모델. #### PARAMETER 1. **Input Columns***: 입력값 이름. 숫자 유형의 값만 가능합니다. 2. **Number of Components**: 혼합 컴포넌트의 수 3. **Covariance Type**: 사용할 공분산 모수의 유형을 설명하는 문자열입니다. 다음 중 하나여야합니다: * `Full` : 각 컴포넌트에 고유한 공분산 행렬 * `Tied` : 모든 컴포넌트기 동일한 공분산 행렬을 공유 * `Diagonal` : 각 컴포넌트에 자체 대각선 공분산 행렬 * `Spherical` : 각 컴포넌트 요소에 고유한 단일 분산 4. **Tolerance**: 수렴 임계 값. 하한 평균 게인이 임계 값보다 낮으면 EM 반복이 중지됩니다. 5. **Regularization of Covariance**: 공분산의 대각선에 음이 아닌 정규화룰 추가. 공분산 행렬이 모두 양수임을 보장 할 수 있습니다. 6. **Number of Iteration**: 수행 할 EM 반복 횟수. 7. **Method to Initialize**: 가중치, 평균 및 정밀도를 초기화하는 데 사용되는 방법입니다. 다음 중 하나 여야합니다: * `K-means` : 결과값이 kmeans를 사용하여 초기화 됩니다. * `Random` : 결과값이 무작위로 초기화 됩니다. 8. **Seed**: 랜덤 시드. 동일한 결과를 재현하려면 동일한 시드를 사용하십시오. 9. **Group By**: 그룹화 할 열입니다. ### Python #### USAGE ``` gaussian_mixture_train(table, input_cols, number_of_components=1, covariance_type='full', tolerance=0.001,regularize_covariance=0.000001, max_iteration=100, initial_params='kmeans', seed=None, group_by=None) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 테이블의 학습 데이터. 라벨에 대한 열을 하나 이상 포함해야합니다. #### OUTPUT 1. **model**: (Model) 학습된 가우시안 혼합 모델. #### PARAMETER 1. **input_cols***: 입력값 이름. 숫자 유형의 값만 가능합니다. * Type: *list[str]* 2. **number_of_components**: 혼합 컴포넌트의 수. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 1 (value >= 1) 3. **covariance_type**: 사용할 공분산 모수의 유형을 설명하는 문자열입니다. 다음 중 하나여야합니다: * `full` : 각 컴포넌트에 고유한 공분산 행렬 * `tied` : 모든 컴포넌트기 동일한 공분산 행렬을 공유 * `diagonal` : 각 컴포넌트에 자체 대각선 공분산 행렬 * `spherical` : 각 컴포넌트 요소에 고유한 단일 분산 * Type: *str* * Default / Range: full ( full | tied | diag | spherical ) 4. **tolerance**: 수렴 임계 값. 하한 평균 게인이 임계 값보다 낮으면 EM 반복이 중지됩니다. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 0.001 (value > 0) 5. **regularize_covariance**: 공분산의 대각선에 음이 아닌 정규화룰 추가. 공분산 행렬이 모두 양수임을 보장 할 수 있습니다. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: 0.000001 (value > 0) 6. **max_iteration**: 수행 할 EM 반복 횟수. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 100 (value >= 1) 7. **initial_params**: 가중치, 평균 및 정밀도를 초기화하는 데 사용되는 방법입니다. 다음 중 하나 여야합니다: * `kmeans` : 결과값이 kmeans를 사용하여 초기화 됩니다. * `random` : 결과값이 무작위로 초기화 됩니다. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: kmeans ( kmeans | random ) 8. **seed**: 랜덤 시드. 동일한 결과를 재현하려면 동일한 시드를 사용하십시오. * Type: *int* * Default value: None 9. **group_by**: 그룹화 할 열입니다. * Type: *list[str]* * Default value: None ## Example ### VA **[Related Tutorial]** **[Sample Model]** 이 실습 워크 플로우에서 sample_iris 데이터는 가우스 혼합을 학습하는데 사용됩니다. 생성된 모델은 나중에 가우스 혼합 예측 함수를 사용하여 데이터 클러스터를 예측하기 위한 테스트 데이터 세트에 적용됩니다. 이 기능에 사용 된 파라미터 설정은 다음과 같습니다. ++Parameters++ 1. **Input Columns***: sepal_length, sepal_width 2. **Number of Components**: 3 3. **Covariance Type**: Full 4. **Tolerance**: 0.001 5. **Regularization of Covariance**: 0.000001 6. **Number of Iteration**: 100 7. **Method to Initialize**: K-means 8. **Seed**: None 9. **Group By**: None ### Python ``` from brightics.function.clustering import gaussian_mixture_train input_table = inputs[0] result = gaussian_mixture_train(table=input_table, input_cols=['sepal_width', 'sepal_length'], number_of_components=3, covariance_type='full', tolerance=0.001, regularize_covariance=0.000001, max_iteration=100, initial_params='kmeans', seed=None, group_by=None) output = result['model'] ``` In this python script, sample_iris data is used to train a gaussian mixture. The generated model can be applied to a test data set to predict the cluster of data, by using Gaussian Mixture Predict function.
